meanings.definition: To introduce gradually or impart gradually
meanings.sent1: She instils kindness in her students through daily acts of generosity.
meanings.sent2: The teacher instils important values in her students through storytelling.
meanings.sent3: He instils a love for learning in his students by making lessons fun and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery instils a sense of peace in all who visit the park.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of the elder instil wisdom in the younger generation.

meanings.definition: To infuse or implant by repeated, gradual, or persistent effort
meanings.sent1: The coach instils discipline in the team by setting clear expectations.
meanings.sent2: Parents often instil good manners in their children through consistent reminders.
meanings.sent3: The magician instils a sense of wonder in the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song instils a feeling of nostalgia in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies instils a sense of comfort in the house.
